spanishExample: ¡Créeme! Lo que yo necesitaba es igual que lo que tú necesitas.
englishTranslation: Believe me! What I needed is the same as what you need.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
necesitaba: needed, I needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 1st person)
necesitabas: needed, you needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Créeme! Si lo miras, verás que es claro.
englishTranslation: Believe me! If you look at it, you’ll see it’s clear.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
miras: look, you look (Mirar, present, 2nd person)
verás: will see, you will see (Ver, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¡Mira! No está listo para vivir conmigo.
englishTranslation: Look! He isn’t ready to live with me.
vocabIncluded: para: "in order", "in order to" before an infinitive

spanishExample: ¡Mírame! Tengo todos los bienes.
englishTranslation: Look at me! I have all the goods.
vocabIncluded: mírame: look at me (Mirar, imperative contraction)

spanishExample: ¡No mires el mes pasado!
englishTranslation: Don’t look at the past month!

spanishExample: Crees que ellos están mirando la cama.
englishTranslation: You think they are looking at the bed.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
crees: believe, you believe (Creer, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: De todas formas, ellos te necesitan.
englishTranslation: Anyways, they need you.
vocabIncluded: necesitan: need, he/she/it need (Necesitar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Esa ciudad fue el primer lugar donde vivimos.
englishTranslation: That city was the first place where we lived.
vocabIncluded: vivimos: lived, we lived (Vivir, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Ese perro es rápido y queremos que lo mires.
englishTranslation: That dog is fast and we want you to look at it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mires: look, you look (Mirar, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Estoy pensando, creo que él necesita lo mismo que ella necesitaba.
englishTranslation: I’m thinking; I think he needs the same thing she needed.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
necesitaba: needed, he/she/it needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: La casa donde vivo es igual a donde tú has vivido.
englishTranslation: The house where I live is the same as where you have lived.
vocabIncluded: has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)
vivo: live, I live (Vivir, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Las personas que viven ahí son justas y necesitamos su ayuda.
englishTranslation: The people who live there are fair and we need their help.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
necesitamos: need, we need (Necesitar, present, 1st person plural)
viven: live, they live (Vivir, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Miran a la primera persona en necesitar su ayuda.
englishTranslation: They look at the first person to need their help.
vocabIncluded: "the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
en: “at”/“of”, as in “la primera persona en hacer eso” NEEDS WORK wrong subcategory
miran: look, they look (Mirar, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Miro el lugar donde yo vivía.
englishTranslation: I look at the place where I used to live.
vocabIncluded: miro: look, I look (Mirar, present, 1st person)
vivía: lived, I lived (Vivir, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Necesitabas pensar en eso.
englishTranslation: You needed to think about that.
vocabIncluded: necesitabas: needed, you needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Necesito que vivas donde yo viví.
englishTranslation: I need you to live where I lived.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)
vivas: live, you live (Vivir, subjunctive, 2nd person)
viví: lived, I lived (Vivir, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Pensé en la chica que vivía ahí.
englishTranslation: I thought about the girl that used to live there.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
pensé: thought, I thought (Pensar, preterite, 1st person)
vivía: lived, he/she/it lived (Vivir, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quiere que mire al perro que está viviendo ahí.
englishTranslation: She wants me to look at the dog(pet) that is living there.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
al: "to the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: Quiere que viva con él.
englishTranslation: He wants me to live with him.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
viva: live, I live (Vivir, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Quiero que él viva en un lugar que está bajo.
englishTranslation: I want him to live in a place that is low.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
viva: live, he/she/it live (Vivir, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quiero que miren el lugar donde vives.
englishTranslation: I want them to look at the place where you live.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
miren: look, they look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
vives: live, you live (Vivir, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Siempre mira lo que tiene que mirar.
englishTranslation: She always looks at what she has to look at.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
mira: looks, he/she/it looks (Mirar, present, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Vivió en Argentina por un tiempo, pero ahora vive en Colombia.
englishTranslation: He lived in Argentina for a while, but now he lives in Colombia.
vocabIncluded: vive: lives , he/she/it lives (Vivir, present, 3rd person)
vivió: lived, he/she/it lived (Vivir, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Vivo en un lugar donde el fuego es un arma.
englishTranslation: I live in a place where fire is a weapon.
vocabIncluded: vivo: live, I live (Vivir, present, 1st person)
